title: Fractional CFO (2 days/wk)
description:
Fractional CFO (2 days/week)

#### **Why AeroShield might be great for you:**


AeroShield Materials is building the next generation of super\-insulating aerogel window technology to dramatically improve energy efficiency in buildings. As a collaborative deep\-tech startup transitioning from advanced R\&D into manufacturing scale\-up, we are looking for leaders who enjoy solving complex problems while building practical systems that enable growth.


Joining AeroShield means working with a passionate, mission\-driven team of about 25 people focused on innovation, sustainability, and strong cross\-functional collaboration. We value people who embody our core principles — **Value People, Act Sustainably, and Understand \& Improve** — and who want to help shape how our organization scales.

#### **What we are looking for in a Fractional CFO:**


The Fractional CFO will establish AeroShield’s financial operating system during a critical scale\-up phase, translating technical, manufacturing, and commercial plans into clear financial strategy. This role combines strategic finance leadership with hands\-on operational governance, ensuring strong liquidity visibility, investor\-ready reporting, and scalable processes appropriate for a Series A deep\-tech environment.


Working closely with the CEO and leadership team, this role provides oversight of outsourced accounting while building lightweight but robust financial systems that support manufacturing growth, fundraising readiness, and commercialization.

#### **Responsibilities of this position include:**

**Strategic Financial Planning \& Modeling**

* Own financial planning processes including forecasting, budgeting, and long\-range modeling
* Integrate manufacturing scale\-up assumptions, hiring plans, and commercial strategy into financial models
* Establish dashboards and reporting structures that support decision\-making and investor communication

**Cash, Liquidity \& Treasury Management**

* Maintain clear visibility into runway, burn rate, and capital allocation
* Support leadership with treasury strategy, banking relationships, and liquidity planning
* Introduce scalable treasury policies aligned with Series A operations

**Financial Reporting, Governance \& Approvals**

* Oversee outsourced accounting partners and ensure quality and compliance
* Implement structured monthly reporting and budget vs. actual reviews
* Design approval workflows and financial governance processes that reduce CEO operational load while maintaining financial rigor
* Lead variance reviews and financial control processes

**Manufacturing Economics \& Strategic Finance**

* Translate techno\-economic analysis and manufacturing assumptions into financial models and pricing strategy
* Provide structured analysis of capex vs. opex tradeoffs and scaling scenarios
* Support procurement, facility planning, and commercialization decisions through financial analysis

**Board, Investor \& Fundraising Support**

* Support board reporting, fundraising narratives, and investor communications
* Participate in strategic discussions around venture debt, project finance, and commercial agreements
* Establish scalable investor reporting processes

**Grant Finance, Compliance \& Operational Support**

* Provide oversight of grant finance structures, compliance workflows, and funding strategies
* Support facility planning, commercial contract evaluation, and finance\-adjacent operational decisions during scale\-up
* Ensure financial processes integrate cleanly with equity administration and HR governance touchpoints

#### **Qualifications:**


Many great candidates do not fit a standard blueprint. If you bring relevant experience and are excited about our mission, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every qualification listed.

**Required Experience \& Skills**

* CPA required; MBA preferred
* Finance leadership experience in early\-stage manufacturing, climate tech, or deep\-tech startups
* Strong financial modeling, forecasting, and liquidity planning capabilities
* Experience managing outsourced accounting partners or hybrid finance organizations
* Familiarity with manufacturing cost structures, capex planning, and operational finance governance
* Board\-level communication skills and experience supporting fundraising or investor reporting
* Experience with grant finance, government programs, or co\-development funding structures

**Preferred Experience**

* ERP evaluation or implementation exposure
* Commercial deal structuring or project\-finance experience
* Experience designing finance systems and approval governance in scaling startups

**Working Style \& Traits**

* Methodical, pragmatic, and low\-ego collaborator
* Comfortable working across technical, commercial, and operational teams
* Able to balance financial rigor with startup velocity
* Strong prioritization skills in a fractional executive role

#### **How to Apply:**


Please submit your resume via our career portal at:


https://careers.jobscore.com/careers/aeroshieldmaterialsinc


Please include a few sentences about why you’re excited about AeroShield and how this role aligns with your experience. This does not need to be a formal cover letter — we simply want to understand what motivates you.

#### **About AeroShield:**


AeroShield manufactures a super\-insulating nanoporous form of glass designed to dramatically improve building energy efficiency. Our silica aerogel technology enables windows that are significantly more insulating while remaining transparent and cost\-effective. Learn more at www.aeroshield.tech.

  

Flexible work from home options available.

title: Senior Director of Administration & Operations
company: The Seattle School of Theology & Psychology
description:
**Reports to:** President


**Department:** Business Office


**FLSA Category:** Full\-time, exempt


**Average Hours per Week:** 40


**Summary**
-----------


The Senior Director of Administration \& Operations leads our shared services teams and serves as our organizational integrator—ensuring all parts of our higher education institution work together seamlessly. Reporting to the President and serving on the senior leadership team, you will provide direct supervision to leaders in HR, IT, Accounting, and Campus Services while driving the integration of our systems, processes, people, and technologies. This role requires someone who can both execute work directly and lead teams through change—acting as a “conductor” who ensures all parts of our organization play in harmony. Working alongside our CFO, this role translates strategic vision into practical systems and guides us through operational transformation. We need a systems thinker with strong technical and project management capabilities who can foster collaboration and accountability within a highly relational organization.


**Essential Functions**
-----------------------


*Shared Services Leadership \& Organizational Coordination*


* Oversee and coach HR, IT, Accounting, and Campus Services leaders.
* Build high\-performing shared services teams with clear goals, metrics, and accountability structures
* Foster collaboration among shared services for integrated service delivery
* Develop leadership capacity within teams, coaching managers in change management and cross\-functional collaboration
* Serve as organizational integrator, connecting systems, data, processes, and people across all departments to align internal functions with institutional goals
* Maintain strong campus presence to troubleshoot issues, support operations, and build relational capital across the institution, while bridging strategic priorities with operational realities
* Create clarity around decision\-making authority, processes, roles, and accountability measures
* Collaborate with Dean of the Graduate School and Executive Directors of Centers to ensure operational processes are clear and operational needs are met


*Systems \& Technology Integration*


* Design and implement scalable systems and standard operating procedures (SOPs) that unify operations
* Lead efforts to identify and align business needs with technology solutions, systems, and processes to support effective workflow and operations
* Conduct operational audits to identify and eliminate redundancies, streamline workflows, and improve efficiency
* Direct IT strategy, infrastructure, and support services
* Ensure data flows effectively across departments to enable informed decision\-making and organizational agility


*Financial \& HR Compliance*


* Oversee accounting operations including accounts payable/receivable, payroll processing and approval, and financial transaction monitoring
* Partner with fractional CFO on budget management, financial reporting, and internal controls
* Maintain working knowledge of nonprofit accounting standards and employment law requirements
* Guide HR operations including employee relations, benefits, and workforce planning, while ensuring HR and payroll compliance
* Support audit preparation and manage compliance reporting


*Strategic Planning \& Project Management*


* Translate strategic goals into actionable operational plans with clear timelines, owners, and realistic resource allocation
* Manage complex, cross\-departmental projects using strong project management methodologies
* Partner with business units to align shared services support with institutional priorities and available capacity, establishing clear workload boundaries and service commitments that enable sustainable, effective operations
* Build and deploy organizational project management culture, processes, and communication protocols


*Change Management \& Institutional Leadership*


* Apply expert change management skills to guide the organization through operational transformations and cultural evolution
* Build trust and institutional authority to drive follow\-through on cross\-functional initiatives
* Serve as member of the senior leadership team, contributing to institutional strategy and communicating frequently across all levels of the organization

**Knowledge, Skills \& Abilities**
----------------------------------


*No candidate will possess every quality and the successful candidate will possess many of the following qualifications and personal attributes:*


*Required**:*


* Bachelor’s degree in Business or related field
* Minimum 7\-10 years of leadership experience in administration and operations
* Demonstrated experience managing multiple functional areas in higher education or complex nonprofit organizations
* Strong financial acumen including budgeting, accounting, and fiscal management
* Proven ability to assess, optimize, and implement business systems and software solutions
* Experience embedding equity and inclusion principles into operational practices
* Thorough knowledge of regulatory compliance, risk management, and Title IX requirements
* Proven ability to lead and develop high\-performing teams
* Excellent strategic thinking, problem\-solving, and decision\-making skills
* Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills
* Appreciation for and alignment with The Seattle School mission and Statement of Faith


*Preferred**:*


* Master’s degree in Business, Public Administration, or related field
* Experience in higher education
* Experience managing operations across multiple affiliated entities
* Familiarity with accreditation processes (ATS, NWCCU, and Department of Education)
* Experience thriving in resource\-limited nonprofit environments
* Demonstrated ability to do more with less while maintaining quality

### *Key Competencies:*


* Exceptional collaboration and relationship\-building across diverse stakeholders
* Strategic vision balanced with hands\-on operational execution
* Integrative thinking that connects disparate functions into cohesive systems
* Resourcefulness and creativity in resource\-constrained environments
* Servant leadership style aligned with mission\-driven culture
* Cultural sensitivity and ability to bridge theological and psychological perspectives
* Strong ethical framework and unquestionable integrity
* Flexibility and adaptability in a lean organizational structure

**Compensation \& Benefits**
----------------------------


The Seattle School of Theology \& Psychology provides a competitive total compensation package (salary, benefits, time off and more), aligned with the Seattle nonprofit market. This position has an annualized pay range of $92,000 – $118,000\. For this full\-time position we offer generous paid time off, retirement benefits, a bus pass subsidy, tuition assistance benefits, medical, dental, life, and long\-term disability insurance (100% employee premiums paid by employer) and a Health Savings Account. We also offer a flexible, supportive environment with colleagues committed to a common mission. Hours and schedule are negotiable, and can be done in a combination of remote and on\-campus hours.


**Application Process**
-----------------------


To apply please submit your resume, cover letter and completed Employment Application (Statement of Faith included) to jobs@theseattleschool.edu. The posting will remain open until filled, with preference given to applications received by Monday, March 2, 2026\.


**About the Employer**
----------------------


Established in 1997, The Seattle School of Theology \& Psychology is an interdisciplinary graduate school committed to training people to be competent in the study of text, soul, and culture to serve God and neighbor through transforming relationships. We enact our mission through our various training programs in our graduate school, Allender Center, and Center for Transforming Engagement. Employees at The Seattle School strive to hold the capacity to see relationally and to allow room for the complexity and nuance needed as the global body of Christ

title: Fractional CFO
description:
**Fractional Chief Financial Officer (CFO)**

*Volunteer (Path to Paid)*

**Organization:** VoteMate (501(c)(3\) nonprofit)

**Product:** Live platform at votemate.io

**Commitment:** Fractional / Part\-time (≈1–5 hrs/week)

**Location:** Remote (U.S. preferred)

**Compensation:** Volunteer initially; intended to convert to paid role upon funding

**Reports to:** Founder \& CEO

About VoteMate

VoteMate is a nonpartisan nonprofit that has already built and launched an AI\-powered platform to help voters feel informed, confident, and supported when navigating complex decisions.

The product is live at votemate.io and has been used by real voters. We are now entering our scale and sustainability phase as we prepare for upcoming election cycles, partnerships, and philanthropic funding.

www.VoteMateUS.org

The Role

VoteMate is seeking a Fractional Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to provide senior financial leadership as the organization scales its fundraising, budgeting, and financial reporting.

This is a lightweight but high\-impact role. We’re not looking for someone to overhaul our books — we need a strategic finance partner who can help us present our financials credibly to funders, sharpen our budget narrative, and ensure we have the reporting infrastructure to support growth.

This role is volunteer initially, with a clear intention to convert to a paid leadership position upon funding. The CFO will play an active role in shaping and supporting those funding efforts.

Key ResponsibilitiesBudget \& Financial Management

* Own and refine VoteMate’s annual budget (\~$3M projected) and financial projections
* Ensure budget structure is clear, fundable, and aligned with how foundations evaluate grantees
* Advise on cost allocation across functional areas (Product \& Engineering, Voter Outreach, Operations, Infrastructure)
* Help maintain strong cost\-efficiency metrics and benchmarking against industry peers

Fundraising \& Funder Relations Support

* Partner with the Founder/CEO on financial narratives for foundation pitches and grant applications
* Prepare and review foundation\-ready budget documents, financial summaries, and due diligence materials
* Support financial components of funder conversations with clarity and confidence
* Help translate financial data into compelling stories about impact and efficiency

Financial Reporting \& Compliance

* Advise on financial reporting cadence and formats appropriate for a scaling nonprofit
* Ensure financial practices meet nonprofit compliance standards and funder expectations
* Guide the organization toward audit\-readiness as funding grows
* Review and strengthen internal financial controls and processes

Strategic Finance

* Provide financial perspective on key organizational decisions (hiring plans, vendor spend, program investments)
* Advise on cash flow management, runway planning, and funding milestone mapping
* Help model financial scenarios to support strategic planning and board discussions

Ideal Background

We’re looking for a senior finance leader who’s comfortable in lean, mission\-driven environments. You may be a great fit if you have:

* 10\+ years of experience in finance, accounting, or financial leadership
* Prior experience as a CFO, VP Finance, Controller, or Finance Director — ideally with nonprofit or startup exposure
* Familiarity with nonprofit budgeting, fund accounting, and foundation/grant reporting requirements
* Strong ability to translate financial data into clear, credible narratives for non\-financial stakeholders
* Experience supporting fundraising efforts, grant applications, or investor/funder due diligence
* Pragmatic, low\-ego communication style — comfortable advising in a fast\-moving volunteer environment
* Interest in mission\-driven, nonpartisan, or civic\-oriented work

CPA, nonprofit audit experience, or experience with organizations scaling from early\-stage to $1M\+ in philanthropic funding is a plus, but not required.

Why This Role Matters

* You’ll help VoteMate present itself as a financially credible, fundable organization to major foundations
* Your budget work will directly support funding conversations that determine the organization’s trajectory
* You’ll shape how a growing nonprofit builds its financial foundation for long\-term sustainability
* You’ll work closely with an experienced founder and a committed volunteer leadership team

Pay: $10\.00 per year

Work Location: Remote

title: Supervisor OR Manager | Fractional CFO Practice
description:
**About LCW CPAs**

  



LCW CPAs is a locally owned and operated firm in Lawrence, Massachusetts, committed to protecting our clients’ hard\-earned money while building long\-term client relationships. We offer our diverse client base of businesses and individuals a full suite of services far beyond commodity accounting and tax services. Our team strives to do better and be better by adding value, embracing technology, and championing our client’s goals. As a progressive firm, we are driven by continuous improvement to best serve our clients regionally and nationally. Loyalty and passion fuel us to support our clients achieving their version of the American Dream.

  


**Position Overview**

  



We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Supervisor or Manager (dependent on experience) to join our Fractional/Outsourced CFO team. This position will report to Kelly Gilbert, the practice leader and one of the firm's Shareholders. As a Supervisor or Manager, you will manage several outsourced full charge CFO engagements across industries (not\-for profit and for profit enterprises) for both early stage entities as well as mature entities. You will also develop and mentor associates, ensure client satisfaction, and contribute to the firm's growth and development.

  


**Key Responsibilities**

  


* Plan, supervise, and manage a portfolio of clients, overseeing daily accounting operations, including A/P, A/R, billing, month\-end and year\-end close processes.
* Be detail obsessed!
* Takes personal ownership of their work.
* Manage develop and mentor employees who will report directly to you.
* Reviews associate research, work processes and conclusions to ensure clarity, completeness, and accuracy.
* Complete client work in a technically sound, consistent and reliable way.
* Prepare and review Balance Sheet, P\&L, and General Ledger under the accrual basis of accounting in a proficient manner.
* Review and oversee the completion of:
	+ Monthly reconciliations of key accounts.
* + Monthly and annual closings, including the recording of adjusting journal entries, as needed.
	+ Payroll journal entries utilizing a working knowledge of payroll processing.
	+ Monthly close process for assigned business clients and preparation of monthly financial statements for management use.
* Liaise with outside CPA firms for annual Assurance engagements and tax return preparation.
* Assist with development and adherence to standard operating procedures within practice group.
* Ensure timely collection of data for the preparation of Form 1099s.
* Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of accounting principles and the ability to apply this knowledge to difficult areas or complex client engagements.
* Recognizes potential accounting issues and presents possible solutions to the individual responsible for the engagement.
* Can effectively perform research with minimal supervision and is able to identify and resolve most issues encountered.
* Exhibits an in\-depth knowledge of new accounting pronouncements and uses this knowledge to identify client needs.
* Displays proficiency in Microsoft products, QuickBooks, and other relevant applications, and applies this knowledge to create high\-quality deliverables.
* Seeks opportunities to learn new technologies and communicates technology solutions to client issues and/or to improve engagement efficiency.
* Ensure complete client satisfaction through open communication, demonstrated enthusiasm for their needs, meeting deadlines, and proactively sharing strategies.
* Be an active participant in business development through community involvement, targeted networking and a strong understanding of Firm concepts that distinguish us from competitors.
* Communicate problems and opportunities to the Executive Team as appropriate.

  


**Qualifications**

  


* At least six to ten years of recent full charge corporate or public accounting experience.
* Bachelor’s degree in accountancy or a related field
* A working knowledge of US GAAP.
* Significant QuickBooks experience (both desktop and online versions).
* Prior experience managing teams.
* Tremendous discretion, personal integrity, and a positive attitude.
* Certified Public Accountant (CPA) license (preferred but not required)
* Ability to thrive in a team\-based, fast\-paced environment.
* Strong communication skills (verbal and written).
* Ability to commute to our new Lawrence, MA office.

  


**Why Join LCW CPAs?**

  



At LCW CPAs, we believe in leading a balanced life—one that values personal well\-being, professional excellence, and authentic connection. Our team’s average tenure of over 15 years reflects our commitment to fostering a collaborative, caring community where people genuinely enjoy working together.

  



We’re not your typical accounting firm—we bring all the expertise of Boston and New York without the less than desirable "other stuff." We approach every client relationship as a consigliere—a trusted, knowledgeable advisor who listens, collaborates, and guides with confidence. Whether we're sharing strategies over financials or soup on a Tuesday (yes, during tax season, a different team member brings lunch for the office each week), we’re always investing in one another’s success.

  



At times, we work hard and put in extra hours to meet our commitments. At other times, we lean into the flexibility our culture allows. We value professionalism—but not pretension. We care deeply about the quality of our work, the relationships we build, and the communities in which we live and work.

  



We’re looking for team members who are personal, approachable, and passionate about becoming the go\-to expert for their clients. People who want to grow in a firm that’s not only collaborative but deeply committed to doing great work without sacrificing authenticity.

  



At LCW CPAs, we challenge the status quo, embrace new technology, and continuously strive to do—and be—better. If you're looking for a place where you can grow with confidence, contribute meaningfully, and be supported every step of the way, we think you'll feel right at home.

  


**Salary**: $100,000 – $120,000 per year plus bonus, commensurate with experience.

  



LCW CPAs exists to create opportunities for our people, our clients, and our communities. We are a proud equal opportunity employer.

  



Employment Type: Full Time

title: Director Of Onboarding
description:
**Director of Onboarding**

Serve as the leader of our onboarding team to ensure new clients are set\-up for success in our systems and processes.

**Job Title:** Director of Onboarding

**Classification:** Full\-time, exempt

**Workplace Type:** Primarily in\-office (at least 4 days per week)

**Department:** Onboarding

**Reporting To:** COO

**Who is The Charity CFO, LLC?**

The Charity CFO is a nationally recognized accounting and advisory firm exclusively serving nonprofit organizations. We partner with mission\-driven leaders to provide fractional CFO services, outsourced accounting, and strategic financial guidance that helps nonprofits grow sustainably, remain compliant, and make confident, data\-informed decisions.

Our work goes beyond bookkeeping and compliance. We act as trusted financial partners to nonprofit CEOs, boards, and leadership teams \- helping organizations strengthen financial infrastructure, improve transparency, and align financial strategy with mission impact.

Through our fractional CFO model, we bring senior\-level financial expertise to nonprofits that may not need or be able to afford a full\-time CFO. Our clients rely on us for budgeting and forecasting, audit readiness, grant compliance, financial storytelling, and long\-term financial planning.

At The Charity CFO, we value clarity, accountability, and generosity. We believe strong financial leadership is a catalyst for stronger missions, healthier teams, and greater community impact.

**Our Culture \& Values**

Our culture is grounded in three core values: Lead with Generosity, Own It and Grow, and Radical Transparency. These values shape how we work together, serve our nonprofit clients, and make decisions as a firm.

We believe generosity shows up through support, collaboration, and a willingness to help others succeed. We assume positive intent, create space for growth, and go the extra mile for our clients and each other.

We take ownership of our work and our outcomes. Mistakes are expected; learning is required. We value people who follow through, seek feedback, and are committed to continuous improvement \- both personally and professionally.

We value clear, honest, and timely communication. We share information openly, address challenges directly, and do the right thing even when it’s uncomfortable. Transparency builds trust with our clients, our teammates, and our leadership.

At The Charity CFO, we believe clarity is a form of respect, accountability enables growth, and strong financial leadership helps nonprofit missions thrive. We look for people who align with these values and are excited to contribute to a thoughtful, high\-performing, and mission\-driven firm.

**Our Benefits**

From career advancement to free parking to 14 paid holidays, 4 weeks of PTO, and paid parental leave, our comprehensive benefits package makes it easier to be there for your family, plan for the future, and truly enjoy your downtime. Learn more about all of these benefits .

**Summary**

The Director of Onboarding is a senior leadership role responsible for owning the onboarding operating system and ensuring new nonprofit clients are set up for long\-term success with The Charity CFO. This role is accountable for outcomes, visibility, and risk management, not day\-to\-day task execution.

The Director of Onboarding leads the onboarding team, designs and continuously improves onboarding systems, and ensures leadership has timely, accurate insight into onboarding progress, capacity, and risk. Success in this role is defined by the performance of the team, the quality and timeliness of onboarding outcomes, and strong cross\-functional trust.

**Job Responsibilities**

This is not your typical 9\-5 job with a set list of tasks/responsibilities. Ultimately, the Director is accountable for the success of their team and for enabling the company to meet its broader goals. description:
**Chief Financial Officer/Lead Consultant**

**Classification:** Exempt

**Compensation Range:** $120,000 \- $160,000

**Supervises**: N/A

**Position type:** Full\-time

**Compensation structure:** Salaried

 **About CLC:**


Voted as one of the Best Places to Work in the Inland Northwest multiple times, CLC proudly offers our team members not only competitive wages and benefits, but a flexible, collaborative, and supportive working environment as well. Our team members feel great about supporting our clients \-which are health clinics providing health services to underserved people throughout the U.S. – knowing that our work makes a real difference in people’s lives.

**Work Location and Structure**: Otis Orchards office; Cottage Grove Office; hybrid remote and in office; or fully remote. May require additional in office time depending upon tasks, meetings, or other requirements.

**Travel:** Not expected but could require travel to clients’ offices depending on work assignments.

 **CLC Culture:**


At CLC, we believe that our success is deeply rooted in our shared values and culture. We cherish individuals who understand and embody these values in their everyday work. Your contribution isn't just about completing tasks; it's about embracing our core values and weaving them into every aspect of your role. We invite you to explore our core values listed below and consider how they resonate with you. Our environment encourages you to be genuine while maintaining the highest level of professionalism. Our Employee Manual serves as a guide to uphold these standards and foster a thriving work environment.

**Position Overview:**


We are seeking a strategic and forward\-thinking Chief Financial Officer / Lead Consultant who brings deep experience in Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs), Primary Care Associations (PCAs), or Tribal Health Organizations—and who is equally energized by leading and expanding consulting service lines. This role blends high\-level Fractional CFO work with service\-line leadership, innovation, and client advisory responsibilities.


Beyond providing expert financial leadership, the CFO/Lead Consultant serves as a key driver in shaping CLC’s financial consulting offerings. This includes developing new service methodologies, identifying opportunities for client value creation, and contributing to the growth and evolution of CLC’s service lines. The ideal candidate is a seasoned CFO who thrives in a consulting environment, enjoys solving complex problems across multiple clients, and is invested in building scalable solutions for the broader healthcare marketplace.


While this role does not directly supervise internal staff, the CFO/Lead Consultant influences team growth and performance through coaching, project leadership, and cross\-service\-line collaboration. The individual will manage multiple clients and projects simultaneously, maintaining a high bar for quality, clarity, and timely delivery. Strong communication skills and a commitment to relationship\-building—both internally and externally—are essential to success.

**Essential Functions:**

***Strategic Financial Leadership***

* Serve as a trusted Fractional CFO for FQHCs and other mission\-driven healthcare organizations, delivering high\-level financial strategy, forecasting, and operational insight.
* Translate complex financial data into clear, actionable recommendations that drive organizational stability, sustainability, and growth.
* Oversee and elevate core financial functions, including cash flow management, internal controls, budgeting, and performance analysis, within client organizations.

***Consulting and Advisory Excellence***

* Lead multiple client engagements simultaneously, ensuring high\-quality deliverables, on\-time execution, and exceptional client satisfaction.
* Guide clients through financial, operational, and strategic challenges, provide tailored recommendations and frameworks to support informed decision\-making.
* Build strong, long\-term client relationships and become a valued thought partner to CEOs, CFOs, Board Members and leadership teams.

***Service Line Leadership \& Innovation***

* Play an active role in shaping and expanding CLC’s financial consulting service lines by developing methodologies, tools, and scalable solutions.
* Identify emerging client needs and opportunities to innovate or enhance offerings, ensuring CLC remains at the forefront of financial and healthcare consulting.
* Contribute to service\-line visioning, growth strategies, market positioning, and internal capability building.

***Team Collaboration \& Coaching***

* Provide coaching, feedback, and mentorship to consultants and project teams to strengthen analysis, storytelling, and client communication skills.
* Model accountability, high standards, and clarity across all phases of engagement work—even without direct supervisory responsibilities.
* Collaborate across service lines to share expertise, integrate solutions, and support a unified client experience.

***Thought Leadership \& Impact***

* Represent CLC as a subject matter expert through webinars, conference presentations, articles, and other visibility efforts.
* Contribute insights and content that elevate CLC’s brand and deepen our impact in the FQHC and healthcare consulting space.

**Required Competencies (knowledge, skills, abilities):**

* Advanced financial acumen with the ability to interpret complex data, identify trends and translate insights into clear, actionable recommendations.
* Strong critical thinking skills with the ability to navigate ambiguity, assess risk and develop sound financial and operational strategies.
* Skilled at building trust, communicating clearly, and guiding clients through financial and organizational challenges.
* Ability to lead engagements, influence outcomes and provide coaching across teams even without direct supervisory responsibilities.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to present financial information in a compelling and accessible way.
* Proficient with financial systems, data analysis tools and Microsoft Office, especially Excel.

**Education and Experience:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field required.
* Master’s Degree (MBA, MHA, or similar) preferred.
* CPA, CMA, or related certification preferred.
* 7–10\+ years of progressive financial leadership experience, including time spent as a CFO, Controller, VP of Finance, or similar senior financial role required.
* At least 2\+ years of meaningful experience in an FQHC, Tribal health organization, PCA, or mission\-driven healthcare setting preferred.
* Experience providing strategic financial guidance, managing budgets, forecasting, and overseeing financial operations in a complex healthcare or nonprofit environment.
* Prior consulting, advisory, or project leadership experience strongly preferred—or demonstrated comfort influencing without formal authority.
* Proven experience managing multiple stakeholders, projects, or organizations simultaneously.
* Background in building processes, frameworks, or service offerings is a strong plus (service\-line leadership/entrepreneurial mindset).

**Physical Requirements:**

* Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.
* Able to travel as needed.

**Benefits:**

  

Community Link Consulting offers a comprehensive benefits package to eligible employees. These include optional participation in our employer\-paid health insurance plan (depending upon the plan you choose), voluntary dental and voluntary vision insurance, a Dental/Vision Consumer Driven Health annual benefit of $1,200, two optional FSA plans, employer\-paid Life, AD\&D, and Long\-Term Disability insurance, and a 401K retirement plan which begin the 1st of the month following 30 days of employment.


Additional benefits include paid time off which accrues from day one for immediate use. We also offer an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) to provide additional support. In addition to these core benefits, we provide the flexibility to work from home, home office allotment, access to IT concierge services, career development training, educational opportunities, and a collaborative and respectful workforce.

**Core Values:**

* **RESPECT**
* **LEADERSHIP**

title: Fractional Non-Profit CFO
description:
**Job Summary**



Brand K Partners, located in North Haledon, NJ is a passionate team of highly skilled individuals devoted to improving the operational efficiencies of small to mid\-sized organizations, specializing in the nonprofit sector. We work with our clients to create customized, affordable solutions to serve their bookkeeping and financial management needs while offering our employees a work\-life balance.



Reporting to the Brand K Partners Chief Executive Officer, the Fractional Chief Financial Officer (CFO) is a senior\-level executive who is responsible for overseeing the financial health, sustainability, and compliance for our Brand K clients. The role is ideal for a small nonprofit that needs executive\-level financial stewardship without a full\-time CFO. The Fractional CFO will provide strategic decision\-making and transparent communication with key stakeholders using financial planning, budgeting, accounting, risk management, and reporting. The Fractional CFO will also work closely with the Brand K accounting teams to deliver accurate reporting and help drive Brand K revenue growth. This job is a part\-time hourly position based predominantly in our North Haledon, NJ Office with some travel within the New York/New Jersey region.


**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS**


**CLIENT ADVISORY**


Financial Strategy \& Leadership: Develop and execute financial strategies to support long\-term organizational sustainability.
Serve as a strategic advisor to the Executive Director and Board on financial planning, forecasting, and risk.
Collaborate with the client’s and or Brand K Finance and Accounting Team, fostering a culture of accountability, accuracy, and collaboration.
Participate in organization\-wide strategic planning initiatives.
Budgeting \& Forecasting: Provide input to client’s long\-range planning committees to establish and execute long\-term organizational goals.
Collaborate with senior client leadership to prepare and set compensation levels, capital budgets, and establish other financial priorities.
Develop multi\-year financial projections to support organizational growth and strategic goals.
Collaborate with the client’s and or Brand K Finance and Accounting Team in the annual budgeting process and provide ongoing analysis of budget\-to\-actual performance.
Monitor budget vs actuals and make strategic suggestions to address large variances.
Accounting \& Financial Operations: Oversee day\-to\-day accounting functions, including accounts payable/receivable, payroll, and general ledger management.
Ensure timely month\-end and year\-end close processes.
Establish and maintain strong internal controls, financial policies, and operational procedures.
Assist client leadership with risk management and proper insurance coverage on all assets and operations.
Oversee key vendor relationships including accounting, payroll providers, employee benefits, etc.
Financial Reporting: Prepare and present accurate, timely financial reports for the CEO, Board of Directors, and funders.
Provide clear interpretation of financial results and trends to support informed decision\-making.
Coordinate grant and contract financial reporting, ensuring compliance with funder requirements.
Compliance, Audit, \& Risk Management: Ensure compliance with GAAP, IRS regulations (e.g., Form 990\), and non\-profit accounting standards.
Manage the annual audit process, liaising with external auditors, audit committees, client finance staff, and the Brand K team.
Maintain organizational insurance policies and oversee risk management strategies.
Monitor federal, state, and local regulations that impact the organization.
Grants \& Fund Development Support: Partner with development staff to create budgets for grant proposals and provide financial documentation to funders.
In collaboration with the Brand K Partners team, oversee the tracking of restricted vs. unrestricted funding and ensure proper revenue allocation.
Ensure compliance with grant requirements and stewardship of donor funds.
Work with Development, client Leadership and Auditors to quantify impact of campaigns and donations on Public Support test.
Evaluate CRM and Accounting systems for sufficient information for future planning and forecasting.
Cash Flow \& Investment Management: Monitor cash flow and develop strategies to ensure financial stability.
Assist client leadership in establishing appropriate reserve rates, investment guidelines, endowments, board designated reserves, etc. to achieve strategic, long\-term initiatives.
Oversee banking relationships, reserve funds, lines of credit, and investment activities as appropriate.

**CLIENT / SYSTEM IMPLEMENTATIONS:**


Work with Brand K team in client implementations, system, and data setups, where needed to support advisory services.
Take the lead in streamlining processes where appropriate to deliver agreed\-upon advisory services.
Keep abreast of system enhancements and upgrades that can create efficiencies for Brand K Team and Brand K clients.
Suggest and oversee system upgrades or conversions to meet client future needs.

**REVENUE GROWTH:**


Actively monitor opportunities for client upsell to meet future client needs.
Attend prospective client sales meetings to review client reporting and systems.
Assist in defining client proposal/contract scope and pricing.
Attend industry networking conferences and meetings to strengthen client/vendor/competitor relationships.
Maintain relationships with key providers/competitors to understand Brand K positioning in the marketplace.
**EDUCATION \| SKILL REQUIREMENTS**


Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance; CPA and/or Master’s Degree in Business Administration or related area required.
Minimum of 8\+ years of CFO level management experience within an Accounting or Finance department, preferably in the non\-profit sector.
Knowledge of nonprofit accounting required.
Strong financial analysis, forecasting, and budgeting skills.
Experience overseeing audits, managing federal and state grants, managing compliance activities.
Strong understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).
Computer literacy in Microsoft Excel, QuickBooks, Sage Intacct, Blackbaud Financial Edge, and/or Fund\-EZ.
**COMPETENCIES \| PERSONAL QUALITIES**


Strategic, Independent and highly analytical self\-starter with the ability to plan and prioritize work schedules.
Ability to multi\-task and work with multiple clients/staff members.
Ability to build sustainable client relationships and trust with client accounts.
Superior oral and written communication and presentation skills, ability to communicate financial information to non\-financial audiences.
Commitment to the mission, vision, and values of Brand K.
A strong team collaborator.
Demonstrated ability to lead and supervise the work of others.
Ability and willingness to travel to client sites as required.
Ability to attend early morning, evening or weekend meetings for Board meetings and client deadlines.

Please send resume and cover letter to **info@brandkpartners.com**


***Brand K Partners Is an Equal Opportunity Employer***

description:
Location: Springfield, MO (**In\-Person**)

First, before you read on. Does this describe you?

* You like clean books the way some people like clean kitchens
* You notice when something doesn’t tie out before anyone else does
* You don’t wait to be told what to do, you just handle it
* You are tech\-comfortable and not intimidated by multiple systems
* You prefer progress and clarity over perfection paralysis
* You like owning your domain but being part of a strong, cohesive team
* You naturally see process failures before they become expensive problems

If this resonates with you, keep reading.  
You might be exactly who we’re looking for.

Who We Are

Good Company is a rapidly growing, innovative third\-party logistics (3PL) provider specializing in e\-commerce fulfillment.

We are not a slow, corporate environment.  
We are operational, fast\-moving, and deeply committed to clarity, accountability, and doing things the right way.

Our culture is:

* High trust
* High ownership
* Low bureaucracy
* No nonsense
* No office formalities

We value people who speak up, think critically, and take real ownership of their work.  
If you like having a voice at the table and being trusted to run your lane, you’ll fit in well here.

The Role (What This Actually Is)

This is the **financial execution engine** of the company.

You will own the day\-to\-day accounting operations that keep our books clean, reconciled, and decision\-ready at all times.

Not theoretical accounting.  
Not endless research.  
Not hiding behind process.

Execution. Clarity. Ownership.

Your Mission (Should You Choose to Accept It)

* Own our QuickBooks Online environment and keep it clean, current, and accurate
* Process AP invoices and manage the AP inbox (no backlog chaos)
* Reconcile bank accounts and credit cards weekly
* Match and track AR and client invoices
* Record journal entries and maintain ledger integrity
* Support monthly close through reconciliations and tie\-outs
* Track payroll recordings and operational cost allocations
* Flag inconsistencies, discrepancies, and risks early
* Help maintain financial hygiene in a fast\-growing operational business

You are the person making sure the financial engine never falls behind.

What Our Environment Looks Like (Real Numbers)

* \~30 AP invoices per week
* \~120 bank transactions per week
* \~20–25 client invoices per week
* High transaction, real\-world operational data
* Slack\-based communication
* Multiple systems (QuickBooks, Google Sheets, internal tools)

If you need a slow, perfectly predictable workflow, this is not your environment.  
If you thrive in organized complexity, you’ll love it here.

Systems You’ll Use Daily

* QuickBooks Online (heavily)
* Google Sheets / Excel
* Slack (primary communication)
* Google Workspace
* Rippling
* Cloud\-based documents and operational data systems

You should be comfortable navigating systems independently without handholding.

Let’s Be Clear About the Level of This Role

This is **not a clerical role.**  
And it is **not a purely strategic finance role** either.

It sits in the middle.

You will:

* Own the books
* Maintain financial clarity
* Keep systems clean and current
* Execute the daily accounting engine

Yes, that includes invoice entry, reconciliations, and transaction work.  
But the expectation is ownership, judgment, and process awareness — not mindless task processing.

If you are overqualified and only want to do high\-level strategy work, this role will feel too hands\-on.  
If you are looking for repetitive clerk work with narrow scope, this role will feel too autonomous.

What Success Looks Like in 90 Days

* Books are fully reconciled and current
* AP and AR are organized and predictable
* Minimal backlog, high clarity
* Clean financial visibility for leadership at all times
* Issues flagged early, not discovered late

Who You Are (Must Be True)

* 3\+ years of hands\-on bookkeeping or staff accounting experience
* Strong QuickBooks Online user (daily operator, not beginner)
* Detail\-oriented **and** action\-oriented
* Highly reliable and responsive
* Tech\-comfortable and systems\-minded
* Able to work autonomously and manage your own to\-do list
* Comfortable working with remote employees and relying on communication systems
* Desire to be the primary accounting operator in a growing company

Strong Bonus Points (But Not Required)

* Experience in logistics, eCommerce, or operational businesses
* Experience managing high\-volume transaction environments
* Experience cleaning up messy books or improving processes

Personality Fit (Very Important)You will thrive here if:

* You like ownership more than micromanagement
* You are calm, organized, and dependable
* You communicate clearly and proactively
* You enjoy improving processes, not just following them
* You take pride in clean, accurate execution

You will NOT enjoy this role if:

* You need rigid structure and perfectly predictable workflows
* You prefer to know with 100% certainty before taking action
* You are uncomfortable with your work being visible and transparent
* You require constant in\-person communication instead of async updates
* You prefer highly repetitive, single\-task clerk\-style work
* You struggle working in a diverse, fast\-paced team environment
* You resist evolving systems and improving processes

A Final Note

We don’t care about titles or ego.  
We care about reliability, clarity, and someone who takes ownership of keeping the financial engine clean and decision\-ready.

If you are the kind of person who sees where a process is going to break before it actually breaks,  
you will likely love this role.

How to Apply

Apply here and upload your resume.

Then include a short note answering this question so we know you read the full posting:  
**Does pineapple belong on pizza? Why or why not?**

(There is no right answer. We care more about attention to detail than the answer.)

title: HR Business Partner
description:
**HR Business Partner (HRBP)** **Location: Remote in USA**  

Humani HR is a boutique Human Resources consulting firm that serves as business partners to executives of small and medium\-sized businesses. We act as our client’s fractional HR Partner to support their varying People Operations needs, including policy \& handbook development, HR software implementation, performance management, compensation strategy, training \& development, talent strategy, day\-to\-day employee relations, HR operations and more. To learn more about us and our team, visit our website.
  

**About You and the Role** At Humani, we are a team of modern\-thinking HR professionals. The **HR Business Partner** will be the go\-to person for multiple clients across multiple jurisdictions and industries. The ideal candidate is capable of helping clients with complex people and culture problems, by finding and implementing unique, customized solutions. You have a breadth of knowledge of HR employment law and employee relations in multiple states (California and New York are ideal!). You bring skills in client and project management, attention to detail, and stellar written and verbal communication, along with an ability to guide an organization, its leadership and its people through change.
  

You thrive in environments where you don’t know the answer but are willing to do the work and figure it out, enjoy creating HR policies and programs from the ground up and working in a fast\-paced and changing environment. You find joy in meaningful work and delivering excellent client results. At Humani, no two days are the same. If this sounds like a great fit for you, we encourage you to apply!  

**We’re looking for an HR Business Partner to join our team. This role is primarily remote, and we welcome applicants from anywhere within the United States. This position requires some onsite (up to 10%) support at various client sites. As such, local and international travel may be required from time to time based on business needs.**  

**What You Will Do*** Acting as the go\-to HR business partner for multiple clients across multiple jurisdictions
* Analyzing the client’s current HR programs and designing the HR roadmap for clients, based on their engagement specifics.
* Ensuring the organization meets compliance standards for their jurisdiction.
* Ensuring HR agendas are aligned with labour law issues.
* Developing, reviewing, and applying HR policies and procedures where necessary.
* Working on client files with more complex compensation projects. Data analytics required.
* Reviewing HR software and processes, spearheading HRIS implementation when necessary.
* Reviewing and/or developing performance management processes in line with current best practices.
* Designing compensation plans based on market data and industry standards.
* Managing employee relations issues as they arise.
* Providing coaching and mentorship to management \& employees.
* Creating and delivering HR\-related training sessions.
* Attending virtual and in\-person meetings with the client’s executives and employees.
* Acting as the lead relationship manager between Humani and our client’s C\-Suite.


**Your Skill Set*** **Employment Law \& Legislation:** We are looking for an HRBP with strong knowledge of US employment law and legislation across multiple states. Union/labour relations experience is a plus!
* **Analytical, problem solving, and critical thinking:** HRBPs need to be able to absorb a great deal of information about the client's business and what they are looking for Humani to accomplish for them. This then needs to be analyzed to make clear recommendations, followed by the execution of the solution.
* **Time Management:** HRBPs must actively manage their time to meet deadlines and remain within the client's budget.
* **Listening, verbal communication, and interpersonal skills:** HRBPs need to interact with many of the client's executives and employees regularly. As such, effective communication skills and heightened self\-awareness are a must.
* **Organizational skills:** Clients rely on our HRBPs to be organized and efficient with their approach to solving their problems and implementing solutions.
* **Data Analysis:** Ability to analyze data, documents, reports, etc., with meticulous attention to detail.
* **Relationship Management:** Strong experience with managing a portfolio of clients and stakeholders, proactively identifying opportunities and proposing and implementing solutions.
* **Technology:** Strong aptitude for learning new technology. Excellent spreadsheet and presentation\-making capabilities are a must. We use Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), but experience with these specific tools is not required as long as you're comfortable transitioning from similar platforms.
* **HR Software:** Ability to use and adapt to multiple HR software programs used by our clients.
* **Project Management:** A working knowledge of project management principles and best practices. Change Management experience is ideal.

  

**Who You Are*** Minimum of 5\+ years of client\-facing HR business partner experience.
* Minimum of 2\+ years managing work deliverables within an HR team.
* A degree or diploma in HR or related field.
* Professional HR designation is an asset
* **A true passion for HR:** Experience building HR systems and processes from scratch and keeping an eye out for the latest HR trends and changes to best practices!
* **Problem Solving:** Ability to work through a problem with limited information and to take a problem or situation to the next steps.
* **Attention to Detail:** Excellent attention to detail and ability to make deliverables (documents, Powerpoints, reports, etc) client\-ready.
* **Creativity:** We’re looking for outside\-the\-box thinkers! Our HRBPs have the flexibility and creativity to handle any situations that arise while implementing solutions for the client.
* **Self\-motivation and self\-discipline:** This is a highly autonomous role where HRBPs work independently supporting clients and must be self\-motivated to complete work promptly with minimal oversight. We aren’t just strategic partners – we do the work and give our clients full white glove service.

  

**Our Company Perks!**We know we are looking for top\-tier skills and experience. But that’s because we offer top\-tier compensation and benefits, which include:* Base salary $80,000\-$100,000 with potential to earn up to 10\-25\+% of base salary through our annual performance\-based bonus program (Total compensation up to $88,000\-$125,000\+).
* 4 weeks paid vacation, plus 5 wellness days annually.
* Full Health Benefits
* 401k Program
* Your Professional HR association fees are reimbursed.
* Opportunity for meaningful growth, both personally and professionally, where your unique background and experience is welcomed and valued.
* Company\-wide retreats and team events to build connections in person.

  

*At Humani, we are in the business of helping our clients build incredible workplaces, so it is important that we do the same. We are committed to building and fostering an environment where our team feels included, valued, and heard. We believe that a strong commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion enables us to make the world better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.*  

*We take a human‑led approach to our recruitment process; however, from time to time, AI\-supported tools are used to help us. All hiring decisions are made by humans.*

description:
**Job Title \- Chief AI Officer (On Demand)**

title: Executive Director
description:
**Employment Type:** Full\-Time or Part\-Time (Flexible)  

**Reports To:** Managing Director / CEO/President  

**Location:** Remote / Hybrid (as needed for client support)


**Pay**: Commensurate with experience

 **Overview**



Momentum Association Management is seeking a Fractional Executive Director to join our growing team. This role is perfect for an individual seeking fractional work and flexibility, while still contributing to a growing company and its client portfolio.

  

The Executive Director (ED) serves as the chief staff officer of the client association and is responsible for the overall leadership, management, and strategic execution of its mission and programs. This part\-time/fractional role is designed to provide executive\-level expertise and operational oversight while offering flexible, scalable support aligned with the organization’s size, goals, and budget.



The ED works closely with the Board of Directors to implement strategic initiatives, manage day\-to\-day operations, and ensure the organization’s long\-term sustainability.

 **Culture Fit: Non\-Negotiables for working at Momentum**



Skills, systems, and workflows can be learned. These are the non\-negotiables when we talk about our team and why we will succeed.



* Client\-First, Ego\-Last


* Reliability is a Core Value


* Comfort with Ambiguity


* Process\-Oriented, Not Just Task\-Oriented


* Direct, Respectful Communication


* Ownership Mentality


* Respect for Time\-Yours and Others’


* Mission Alignment with Associations and Nonprofits


* Growth Mindset Without Drama


* Professional Judgement \& Discretion
  



**Key Responsibilities**


**Governance \& Board Relations**


* Serve as the primary liaison between the Board and staff, ensuring effective communication and alignment.
* Provide strategic guidance and recommendations to support informed decision\-making.
* Assist with agenda planning, meeting preparation, and follow\-up on Board actions and strategic initiatives.
* Maintain compliance with all bylaws, policies, and applicable regulations.


**Strategic Leadership**


* Execute the organization’s strategic plan and annual objectives as approved by the Board.
* Identify and develop opportunities for growth, partnerships, and innovation.
* Provide leadership that fosters collaboration, accountability, and continuous improvement.


**Operations \& Administration**


* Ensure service delivery is aligned with Momentum’s outlined Client Service Playbook.
* Oversee daily operations, ensuring effective and efficient delivery of programs and services.
* Manage budgets, financial reporting, and ensure sound fiscal stewardship.
* Develop and maintain operational policies, procedures, and systems to support organizational effectiveness.
* Supervise staff, contractors, and volunteers as applicable.


**Membership, Marketing \& Communications**


* Support member engagement and retention initiatives.
* Oversee communication strategies, including newsletters, social media, and web presence.
* Serve as a public representative of the organization to members, partners, and external stakeholders.


**Programs \& Events**


* Lead planning and execution of annual conferences, webinars, certification programs, and educational offerings.
* Ensure alignment of all programs with mission and member value.


**Development \& Sponsorship**


* Identify and secure funding opportunities, sponsorships, and partnerships to support organizational growth.
* Maintain relationships with key funders, partners, and industry stakeholders.

  


**Qualifications**


* Proven leadership experience, ideally in nonprofit, association, or membership\-based organizations.
* Strong strategic planning, financial management, and communication skills.
* Experience working with volunteer Boards and committees.
* Ability to work independently, prioritize multiple projects, and maintain confidentiality.
* Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree or CAE preferred.
* Systems Experiences – Modern AMS systems and Monday.com experience is a plus.

  


**Why Momentum Association Management**



Momentum is a modern, mission\-driven Association Management Company built to give associations flexible, high\-quality support without the rigidity of traditional models. Team members enjoy meaningful work, exposure to diverse organizations, flexible schedules, and a culture that values trust, professionalism, and growth.
